author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: More than 74,000 people have had their lives disrupted by Trump administration cuts to clinical trials supported by the National Institutes of Health, according to a new report released Monday.   From the end of February to August, the administration’s unprecedented broadside against NIH resulted in funding losses for 383 clinical trials, new research published in the journal JAMA Internal Medicine found.  The cuts impacted trials disproportionately studying...
title: NIH funding cuts have impacted over 74,000 people enrolled in trials: Report

author: Tara Suter
description: Former national security adviser John Bolton said Monday that President Trump “put the gun on the table” with Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro amid tensions between the two countries. “I mean, do you think these boat strikes are stopping the flow of drugs to the United States, for one, and do you think they are doing...
title: John Bolton: Trump 'put the gun on the table' with Maduro

author: Nik Miles, TestMiles.com
description: (TestMiles) - The future of electric vehicle adoption shifts now that the $7,500 tax credit is gone; affordable models, tech pivots, and new market dynamics emerge. Why does this matter right now? On September 30, 2025, the $7,500 federal tax credit for electric vehicles vanished. No fanfare, no final countdown. For the EV industry, this is...
title: What's next for EVs after the expiration of the tax credit?

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Rep. Jamie Raskin (D-Md.) said the Democratic Party should welcome Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-Ga.) — a longtime MAGA supporter who’s grown increasingly critical of the GOP — should she choose to switch sides. Speaking at the 2025 "Blue Bash Brunch" Democratic fundraiser in Miami on Sunday, Raskin encouraged his party to be a big...
title: Raskin says Democrats have 'huge' tent with room for Marjorie Taylor Greene

author: Julia Shapero
description: The Trump Organization said Monday it plans to tokenize the development of a new hotel project in the Maldives, merging the Trump family’s newfound interest in cryptocurrency with its long-standing real estate business.  The company, owned by President Trump and led by his two eldest sons, is partnering with Saudi real estate developer Dar Global...
title: Trump Organization unveils crypto-tied hotel project in Maldives

author: Robby Soave, opinion contributor
description: Congresswoman Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-Ga.) is speaking out after President Trump denounced her as a traitor to him and the MAGA movement. This spectacular breakup between the president and one of his closest allies took place last week, with Trump writing on Truth Social:   “I am withdrawing my support and Endorsement of ‘Congresswoman’ Marjorie Taylor...
title: Trump denounces Marjorie Taylor Greene as traitor; MTG responds

author: Julia Manchester
description: President Trump said on Monday his voice sounds hoarse because he was shouting during trade talks.  “I feel great. I was shouting at people because they were stupid about something having to do with trade and a country, and I straightened it out,” Trump told reporters in the Oval Office.  “But I blew my stack...
title: Trump says his voice is hoarse because he was shouting during trade talks

author: Laura Kelly
description: Lobbyists and clergy with ties to the Russian Orthodox Church, which has been a staunch backer of Russian President Vladimir Putin’s war in Ukraine, are campaigning this week on Capitol Hill and meeting with the Trump administration. The delegation is meeting with the White House Faith Office, a White House official confirmed to The Hill....
title: White House to meet clergy with ties to pro-war Russian Orthodox Church

author: Rachel Frazin
description: Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) head David Richardson is departing the agency, a Department of Homeland Security (DHS) spokesperson confirmed Monday.  “The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) and the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) extend their sincere appreciation to the Senior Official Performing the Duties of the Administrator, David Richardson, for his dedicated service and...
title: FEMA chief David Richardson resigns

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: The girlfriend of FBI Director Kash Patel has been receiving a protective detail, the bureau confirmed Monday, a decision it says comes in response to threats. It’s not unusual for the spouse of the FBI director to have a detail, but according to reporting from MS NOW, protection for Alexis Wilkins has tapped SWAT team members...
title: Kash Patel's girlfriend given FBI security detail

author: Joseph Choi
description: Health and Human Services (HHS) Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. said Monday that new dietary guidelines are expected to be released next month that will end the "war on saturated fats." Speaking at the Food Allergy Fund Leadership Forum, Kennedy discussed the actions that the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has taken under his leadership,...
title: RFK Jr. says new dietary guidelines coming soon: 'We're ending the war on saturated fats'

author: Caroline Vakil
description: New York City Council member Chi Ossé, a democratic socialist, filed paperwork on Monday to challenge House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries (D-N.Y.) next year.  Ossé represents the city’s 36th District, which includes North Crown Heights and Bedford-Stuyvesant, in the New York City Council. He has represented the district since 2021.   The New York Post was the first...
title: Chi Ossé files paperwork to run against Hakeem Jeffries in New York

author: Cate Martel
description: It’s Monday. Readers, I’m taking a poll and want to know what you think. Which public breakup has been more stunning to watch: Trump and Elon Musk or Trump and Marjorie Taylor Greene? Email me your vote: cmartel@thehill.com. In today's issue: • President leans into affordability issue • Trump’s stunning Jeffrey Epstein reversal • MTG...
title: Trump turns to McDonald's in affordability push

author: Harlan Ullman, opinion contributor
description: While America has many great things in its favor, all is not in keeping with us being “the greatest nation ever.”
title: Unpacking the idea of ‘The greatest country ever’

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on Sunday that President Trump’s proposal to send $2,000 to most Americans will first require Congress to pass legislation. In an interview on Fox News’s “Sunday Morning Futures,” Bessent touted Trump’s effort to address affordability and lower the cost of living, but hedged when asked about the possibility of direct...
title: Bessent: $2K tariff checks will require legislation in Congress

author: John Kenneth White, opinion contributor
description: The preservation of the American experiment depends on our answer.
title: Voters’ new choice is not left versus right, but up or down

author: Tara Suter
description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams said Jewish people in New York City should be scared when Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani (D) enters office, according to a new report from The New York Times. “If I were a Jewish New Yorker, I’d be concerned about my children,” Adams said Sunday in Tel Aviv, according to the...
title: Adams, in Israel, says Jews should be scared in Mamdani's New York City

author: Josh DuBose
description: In footage of the incident, the 45-year-old is seen pulling a gun from his waistband as he walked up the street, pointing it at the teen’s truck and demanding he stop the vehicle while reportedly brandishing his badge.
title: ICE agent arrested for pulling gun on California teen, lawyer says

author: Ella Lee
description: A federal magistrate judge has ordered the Justice Department to turn over grand jury materials to former FBI Director James Comey as he fights criminal charges, pointing to possible government misconduct as reason to grant the unusual relief.   Judge William Fitzpatrick said that Comey’s right to due process outweighs the typical secrecy afforded to grand...
title: Judge orders DOJ to turn over grand jury materials to James Comey, cites 'disturbing pattern'

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: New international student enrollments at U.S. universities plummeted this fall, according to newly released data, amid crackdowns on multiple fronts from the Trump administration.  The Institute of International Education found a 17 percent drop in first-time new international student enrollments for this fall.  While the overall number of international students remains almost steady with only about...
title: Universities report downturn in new international students

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: The head of the BBC in a note to staff on Monday sought to disspell speculation the outlet could settle a lawsuit if President Trump sues the broadcaster over claims of defamation, as he's threatened to do. Trump late last week said he intends to sue the BBC over a documentary that was edited to...
title: BBC chair 'determined to fight' Trump over threatened defamation lawsuit

author: Emily Brooks
description: Robert P. George, the McCormick professor of jurisprudence at Princeton University, announced Monday that he resigned from the Heritage Foundation board of trustees over the conservative think tank’s president, Kevin Roberts, defending Tucker Carlson for interviewing antisemitic commentator Nick Fuentes. “I have resigned from the board of the Heritage Foundation. I could not remain without a...
title: Heritage Foundation board member resigns over Tucker Carlson defense

author: Svante Myrick, opinion contributor
description: Trump’s efforts to stay in power after losing the 2020 election showed us that he’s willing to subvert democracy.
title: Even Joe Rogan is calling out Trump's election lies

author: Caroline Vakil
description: An Indiana GOP state senator said on Sunday that he had been the victim of a swatting incident, an announcement that came several hours after President Trump criticized him and another Indiana Republican for rebuffing his call to do redistricting in the state. Indiana state Sen. Gregory Goode (R) said in a statement posted on X that...
title: Indiana lawmaker criticized by Trump over redistricting is victim of swatting

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: More than 40 Democratic lawmakers are highlighting and trying to prevent reported Trump administration plans to sell the government's student loan portfolio to the private market.   Last month, Politico reported the Education Department and Treasury Department were discussing the sale of the portfolio, a move the Democrats argue in a Sunday letter would be...
title: Democrats seek to halt Trump's reported plan to sell off student loan portfolio

author: Julia Manchester
description: The White House has officially pulled a Biden-era proposal that would have mandated airlines pay passengers for significant flight disruptions.  According to the Federal Register, the rule was officially withdrawn on Monday. The administration argues nixing the rule introduced in December 2024 is consistent with President Trump’s efforts to scrap federal regulations that the administration considers wasteful. ...
title: White House pulls rule forcing airlines to pay passengers for flight disruptions

author: Douglas E. Schoen, opinion contributor
description: Schumer has managed to alienate virtually everyone in his party.
title: Is this the end of Chuck Schumer?

author: Julia Manchester
description: President Trump floated the possibility of talks with Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro amid the growing U.S. military presence in the Caribbean.  “We may be having some discussions with Maduro, and we’ll see how that turns out. They would like to talk,” Trump told reporters in West Palm Beach, Fla., before returning to Washington on Sunday...
title: Trump floats talks with Maduro amid military buildup

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: President Trump rejected Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene’s (R-Ga.) concerns for her own safety on Sunday evening amid their ongoing feud over releasing the Jeffrey Epstein files. Speaking to reporters on the tarmac before leaving Palm Beach, Fla., Trump doubled down on calling the staunch MAGA supporter a “traitor” when asked about Greene saying her life...
title: Trump rejects Greene’s safety concerns, doubles down on ‘traitor’ label

author: William S. Becker, opinion contributor
description: The Supreme Court should admit its error and restore the principle that no one, not even the president of the United States, is exempt from the rule of law.
title: The Supreme Court made a horrible mistake when it gave Trump absolute power

author: David Rees
description: Roughly two dozen states have already done the same.
title: Ohioans could vote on 'a constitutional right to hunt and fish' in 2026

author: Trista Keeton
description: It's the word of the year, but some adults have had enough.
title: Elementary students given 'tickets' for saying '6-7' by Indiana school resource officers

author: Laura Kelly
description: President Trump is welcoming Saudi Arabia’s Crown Prince and de facto leader Mohammed bin Salman to the White House this week, with the visit showcasing deeper U.S. ties to the kingdom despite its troubling human rights record. It will mark another turning point in U.S. relations with the Saudis in the form of fully vested...
title: 3 things to watch as Trump hosts Saudi’s crown prince at White House

author: Alexander Bolton
description: The 43-day government shutdown has exposed the intensifying battle between progressives and centrists over the direction of the Democratic Party in 2026 and beyond, an ideological struggle that could determine whether Congress can avoid another lapse in federal funding in February. The intraparty struggle is taking place on Capitol Hill as well as in key...
title: Shutdown fight exposes growing turmoil within Democratic Party

author: Clara Duhon
description: MSNBC officially rebranded to MS NOW, which stands for My Source for News, Opinion and the World, on Saturday. The name change, which was announced in August, comes as the cable network moves to a new media company, Versant, leaving NBCUniversal as well as nixing the Peacock logo. The network now stands apart from the...
title: MSNBC officially rebrands to MS Now: What to know

author: Tara Suter
description: The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) is set to end all flight reductions at major U.S. airports in the wake of a lengthy government shutdown that caused aviation chaos over the last few weeks. On Sunday, the FAA issued an order to end the reduction of “operations at certain airports by 3 percent” and reinstate “normal...
title: FAA ending all flight reductions at major US airports

author: Tara Suter
description: The Trump administration is set to withdraw some National Guard troops from Chicago and Portland, Ore., according to multiple reports. The New York Times reported Sunday that two U.S. officials said hundreds of National Guard soldiers were being pulled by the Defense Department from the two cities.  The officials also said that around 200 members...
title: Trump administration to withdraw some National Guard troops from Chicago, Portland: Reports

description: Reps. Tom Suozzi (D-N.Y.) and Don Bacon (R-Neb.) on Sunday pitched why their bipartisan Affordable Care Act (ACA) subsidies extension proposal is necessary before the end-of-year expiration date. Their plan, formed with lawmakers from both parties, would extend the current subsidies for the next two years and place an income cap on those making between...
title: Suozzi, Bacon pitch ACA subsidies extension: 'It will save people thousands and thousands of dollars'
